etymology.description: Human figure (大) with emphasis marks at the armpits; originally 腋 ‘armpit’, later phonetic loan for 亦 ‘also’.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person with marks highlighting the armpits, explaining the original meaning ‘armpit’ (腋). Because it matched the sound, the same graph was borrowed to write the function word meaning ‘also’.

examples.chinese: 我亦喜欢古文(我亦喜歡古文)。
他亦参与讨论(他亦參與討論)。
examples.english: He also participates in the discussion.

examples.chinese: 今日亦可出发(今日亦可出發)。
